|cpu1_cores = 1 |cpu1_type = MIPS 24Kc |cpu1_type_rev = |cpu1spd = 400 |is_doc = |bus = |flash1type = |fla1_num = |fla1chip = Macronix;MX25L3205DMI-12G; |flash1size = 4 |flash1maxsize = 3801088 |ram1type = |ram1type1 = |ram1spd = |ram1size = 32 |ram1chip = Mira;P3S56D40ETP-G5; |ram1_num = |nvramsize = |eth_cpu = true |sw_cpu = true |wan_ports = 1 |wan_speed = 100MbE |lan_ports = 4 |lan_speed = 100MbE |ethstandard = |portbasedvlan = |802.1qvlan = |auto_mdix = |sup_jumbo = |ethoui = 00:24:A5 |oui = 00:24:A5 |bootwait = |stockbootloader = U-Boot;1.00;ar7240; |stockos = Linux;2.6.15;; |pwr_volt_type = VDC |pwr_vdc = 5 |pwr_amp_dc = 2 |pwr_conn = barrel |pwr_barrel_outer = |pwr_barrel_inner = |pwr_barrel_len = |pwr_pol = |serial = yes,, (115200 8N1) |jtag = |specialfeat = |flags = |addchip = |802dot11_protocols = bgn |defaulip = 192.168.11.1 |defaultlogin = |defaultpass = |defaultssid = 0024A5XXXXXX |default_ch = |manuf = Cameo |manuf_model = |manuf_rev = |is_manuf = No |tpfirmware = DD-WRT |availability = |eoldate = |fccapprovdate = 07/20/2009 |estreldate = |estprice = |upc = 747464120232 |ean = |dx_sku = |newegg = |asin = B002WBV37Y |asin_country = |asin2 = |asin_country2 = |countrymanuf = China |buttons = |led = |dimensions = |weight = |wi1_if_name = |rad1chip1 = Atheros;AR9283; |rad1oui = |rad1_ant_conn = RP-SMA |rad1txchains = 1 |rad1rxchains = 1 |rad1sstreams = 1 |rad1stand = IEEE 802.11b/g/n |rad1n = 150 |rad1g = 54 |rad1b = 11 |rad1freq = 2.4 }}{{TIDTOC|embedded}} ==Overview== The device is presumed to be manufactured by '''Cameo'''. [http://net.it168.com/a2010/1231/1145/000001145147_all.shtml Review of the device on '''it186.com'''] (decent photos) :This device appears to be using the same board (and 2T2R capable WiFi IC [AR9283]) as the [[Buffalo WHR-HP-G300N]].. despite being a single-stream (and single antenna) device. [http://www.dd-wrt.com/phpBB2/viewtopic.php?p=534754 On the DD-WRT forums] (internal shot) [https://forum.openwrt.org/viewtopic.php?id=23243 '''''Buffalo WHR-HP-GN / WHR-HP-G300N''''' on the '''OpenWrt Forums'''] :Serial settings are 115200, 8, N, 1 Default login credentials and the IP is per '''Buffalo''''s manual. The default SSID for the device appears to be the MAC address (no delimiters, upper case hex letters). ==Links of Interest== *[https://c85091.ssl.cf0.rackcdn.com/WHR-HP-GN_man.pdf Manual] *[https://openwrt.org/toh/hwdata/buffalo/buffalo_whr-hp-gn_v1 Buffalo WHR-HP-GN v1] on OpenWrt wiki *[http://www.dd-wrt.com/phpBB2/viewtopic.php?t=64032 HOWTO flash the Buffalo WHR-HP-GN] On the '''DD-WRT''' Forum *[http://www.dd-wrt.com/phpBB2/viewtopic.php?t=72276 buffalo WHR-HP-GN] On the '''DD-WRT''' Forum *[http://forums.buffalotech.com/t5/Wireless/WHR-HP-GN-and-Buffalo-branded-DD-WRT-14512-is-FLAKY/td-p/31229 WHR-HP-GN and Buffalo branded DD-WRT 14512 is FLAKY!!!] ==Flashing== {{Flashnotice}} ===Flashing dd-wrt=== Supported by dd-wrt as of = v24 SP2 - build 13406 - 20091207 1. Connect computer via switch PC ==> Switch ==> WHR-HP-GN 2. cmd => ping -t -w 10 192.168.11.1
3. tftp ==> browse file xxxx.tftp (download from dd-wrt website)
4. unplug the WHR-HP-GN, and then switch on the WHR-HP-GN
5. Count 1 to 9 (count the response time in cmd) and hit the button (in tftp program)
NOTE>>> You need to find the exact time to hit the button... if not success, try again with another different waiting time ==Reverting== ===Reverting dd-wrt=== Per [http://www.dd-wrt.com/phpBB2/viewtopic.php?p=442229#442229 LOM] Set your pc to static ip 192.168.11.2, netmask 255.255.255.0, gateway 192.168.11.1 open a cmd window and type arp -s 192.168.11.1 ro:ut:er:ma:c open your tftp program, enter filename, destination ip and set retries to 100. Don't start the tftp transfer yet.
(Destination is the router at 192.168.11.1) Power on the router, wait 5 seconds and then start the tftp transfer at the pc. It will normally take another 5-10 seconds before the transfer starts. The above works for WHR-HP-G300N which is basically the same router as WHR-HP-GN [[Category:English Documentation]]
